speaker: Common Room
lines: Benches complain like elders and then settle for newcomers.
A stew bowl circles the room under its own power, escorted by ladles.
Three games happen at once on one table: cards, spoons, and staring.
A cat owns the hearth; it rents warmth to ankles at a fair rate.
The rafters remember smoke that had opinions.
A man with two eyepatches listens perfectly.
Somebody swears they saw a ghost once. Somebody else swears they married one.
The door to the alley sticks when the wind is thinking.

choices.text: Drop a coin for the bard and listen.
Slip into the alley for air.
